\"The Resistance: Avalon\" is a game for 5–10 players designed by Don Eskridge, developed by Travis Worthington, and published by Indie Boards and Cards. It is a trademark of Don Eskridge and Indie Boards and Cards. For the avoidance of doubt, this app is not affiliated with or sponsored by Don Eskridge, Travis Worthington, or Indie Boards and Cards.\n
No profit was made through the distribution of this app.\n
You\'ll need the original \"The Resistance: Avalon\" game in order to use this app.\n
Choose the number of players along the top of the main screen. The range of characters who are available for selection will be automatically adapted to the number of players selected.\n

The special roles in \"The Resistance: Avalon\" are: Merlin, Assassin, Percival, Morgana, Mordred, and Oberon. Select the special roles that you’re using by tapping them on the main screen. Selected (active) characters will have a white frame around them.\n

Some selection rules will apply. For example, you cannot have Morgana without Percival, or Percival/Assassin/Morgana/Mordred without Merlin. In addition, in a 5-player game, you cannot have Percival without either Morgana or Mordred. Some characters will be automatically selected/deselected depending on the selection/deselection of other characters.\n
Tap the Play button when you\'re ready for the night phase to begin (i.e. for all players to close their eyes and for the playback/narration of the introduction script).\n
Tap the gear icon in the lower right corner to view the settings screen, which allows you to customize every aspect of the app.\n

On the Settings screen, tapping the Back button returns you to the main screen. Tapping the Help button displays this Help that you\'re reading now. Tapping the app creator\'s personal logo takes you to his website.\n
The Narration Settings allows you to change the volume of the narration.\n
The Background Settings allows you to change the background sounds and their volume. These background sounds are played during the night phase (to help cover up any sounds made by players).\n
This timer determines the length of the pause during the action of the roles that wake up at night (namely Merlin, Percival, and/or the Agents of Evil).\n
Tap and hold the image of each character to learn his/her role in the game.\n
When the app is active on any screen, it prevents your device from going to sleep. If playing for extended periods of time, you should plug in your device or change the brightness to a low setting.\n
Notifications (calls, mail, messages, etc.) may interrupt the playback of the app, depending on how your notifications are set up.\n

The gear icon in the settings button was taken from www.flaticon.com and designed by Freepik.\n

The cards background sound was taken from the YouTube Audio library. The rest of the background sounds were taken from SoundBible.com. The crickets background sound was recorded anonymously. The fireplace background sound was recorded by Daniel Simion. The rain background sound was recorded by Mark DiAngelo. The rainforest background sound was recorded by glorysunz. The app developer sincerely apologises in advance if he has forgotten to acknowledge/credit anybody else who needs to be acknowledged/credited.\n

The name is a portmanteau of \"narrator\" and \"Nadir\", which is the last name of Abed, one of the main characters of the American television sitcom \"Community\". In one episode involving delicious chicken fingers, Abed narrated a good chunk of the story line, as if \"in a mafia movie\" (his own words). In two other episodes featuring Dungeons & Dragons, Abed was the Dungeon Master, whose tasks include narration. The launcher icon of the app is also a reference to the school logo of Greendale Community College, which is the main setting of this sitcom.
